Class Checker

  • java.lang.Object
    • Checker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CheckerInterface

    public class Checker
extends java.lang.Object
implements CheckerInterface
    implements all methods and functions defined in CheckerInterface

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String color
      Stores the color of the checker object on the board.
      private java.lang.String Coord
      Stores the current location of the checker on the board.
      private boolean king
      Stores true if piece is king.

      Constructor for Checker object sets the color of the checker sets the coordinates of the checker makes the checker a king if it is a king

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String[] CheckerInPath(Checker Checker, Checker[] Checkers, java.lang.String[][] coordinates, java.lang.String prevCoord)
      Checks if there is a Checker in the path of movement of the current checker if so return location of that checker
      java.lang.String[] CheckerInPath2(Checker Checker, Checker[] Checkers, java.lang.String[][] coordinates, java.lang.String prevCoord, java.lang.String com)
      This method figures out what two checkers were behind the checker when it jumped.

      returns the color value of a piece
      java.lang.String getCoord()
      returns the coordinates of the piece
      boolean hop(Checker Checker, Checker[] Checkers, java.lang.String[][] coordinates, java.lang.String prevCoord)
      If the user has a piece in it's path, this method then checks if the user is able to jump over that piece.
      boolean illegalMove(Checker Checker, Checker[] Checkers, java.lang.String[][] coordinates, java.lang.String prevCoord)
      Checks if current move is legal and returns false if it is illegal if the piece is a king, allow backwards and forwards movement if a chain of moves is possible, take all moves in the chain if the square is empty, and not white, allow movement by returning true
      boolean illegalPlacement(Checker Checker, Checker[] Checkers, java.lang.String[][] coordinates)
      sets the white tiles' coordinates to 'null' so that no pieces can be placed on them if the user attempts to place a piece on a null tile or a tile with a piece already in that tile, the method returns true so that the piece cannot be placed
      boolean isKing()
      returns whether or not the piece is a king
      int isSelected(java.lang.String currentTileSelected, Checker[] Checkers)
      checks if the tile selected has the selected checker on it

      Checks if user has made it to other side of board.
      boolean Overlap(Checker Checker, Checker[] Checkers, int index)
      disallows placement of pieces on tiles which already have pieces placed in them this is done by returning true if the coordinates of Checker match the coordinates of the current Checker i in Checkers[]

      Checks the PosssibleMoves For AI

      sets the color value of a piece

      void setKing(boolean king)

    • Field Detail

      • color

        private java.lang.String color
        Stores the color of the checker object on the board. Can be either Black or Grey.

      • king

        private boolean king
        Stores true if piece is king. Otherwise stores false.

      • Coord

        private java.lang.String Coord
        Stores the current location of the checker on the board. Location of form A-5, A-6....

    • Constructor Detail

      • Checker

        public Checker(java.lang.String color,
               java.lang.String Coord,
               boolean king)
        Constructor for Checker object sets the color of the checker sets the coordinates of the checker makes the checker a king if it is a king
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the piece; unchanged once set
        Coord - the currently stored coordinates of the checker piece
        king - boolean value for is the piece is a king or not; unchanged once set

      • illegalPlacement

        public boolean illegalPlacement(Checker Checker,
                                Checker[] Checkers,
                                java.lang.String[][] coordinates)
        sets the white tiles' coordinates to 'null' so that no pieces can be placed on them if the user attempts to place a piece on a null tile or a tile with a piece already in that tile, the method returns true so that the piece cannot be placed
        Specified by:
        illegalPlacement in interface CheckerInterface
        Parameters:
        Checker - checker piece the user wants to place
        Checkers - array of current checkers on the board
        coordinates - a 2-dimensional array of checkers currently on the board used to compare x and y coordinates
        Returns:
        returns true if a piece is already in the coordinates (illegal move) or if the user attempts to place a piece on a white tile returns false otherwise (the move is legal)

      • Overlap

        public boolean Overlap(Checker Checker,
                       Checker[] Checkers,
                       int index)
        disallows placement of pieces on tiles which already have pieces placed in them this is done by returning true if the coordinates of Checker match the coordinates of the current Checker i in Checkers[]
        Specified by:
        Overlap in interface CheckerInterface
        Parameters:
        Checker - current piece attempting to be placed
        Checkers - array of checker pieces currently on the board
        index - the possible index of the checker the user is attempting to place
        Returns:
        returns true if the Checker's coordinates match the coordinates of any piece currently on the board (in the Checkers array)

      • illegalMove

        public boolean illegalMove(Checker Checker,
                           Checker[] Checkers,
                           java.lang.String[][] coordinates,
                           java.lang.String prevCoord)
        Checks if current move is legal and returns false if it is illegal if the piece is a king, allow backwards and forwards movement if a chain of moves is possible, take all moves in the chain if the square is empty, and not white, allow movement by returning true
        Specified by:
        illegalMove in interface CheckerInterface
        Parameters:
        Checker - the current checker the user wishes to move
        Checkers - the array of all checker pieces on the board
        coordinates - a 2-dimensional array of checkers currently on the board used to compare x and y coordinates
        prevCoord - the coordinate that the checker piece that the user wants to move is currently on
        Returns:
        return true if the move is legal, false if the move is illegal

      • hop

        public boolean hop(Checker Checker,
                   Checker[] Checkers,
                   java.lang.String[][] coordinates,
                   java.lang.String prevCoord)
        If the user has a piece in it's path, this method then checks if the user is able to jump over that piece.
        Specified by:
        hop in interface CheckerInterface
        Parameters:
        Checker - checker piece the user wants to place
        Checkers - array of current checkers on the board
        coordinates - a 2-dimensional array of checkers currently on the board used to compare x and y coordinates
        prevCoord - the coordinate that the checker piece that the user wants to move is currently on
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Checker is able to hop over a piece legally, so if there is a piece in front of the selected piece and a legal jump is possible. Otherwise, false is returned.

      • CheckerInPath

        public java.lang.String[] CheckerInPath(Checker Checker,
                                        Checker[] Checkers,
                                        java.lang.String[][] coordinates,
                                        java.lang.String prevCoord)
        Checks if there is a Checker in the path of movement of the current checker if so return location of that checker
        Specified by:
        CheckerInPath in interface CheckerInterface
        Parameters:
        Checker - the current checker the user wishes to move
        Checkers - the array of all checker pieces on the board
        coordinates - a 2-dimensional array of checkers currently on the board used to compare x and y coordinates
        prevCoord - the coordinate that the checker piece that the user wants to move is currently on
        Returns:
        return the location of the checker piece that is in the path of the selected checker

      • CheckerInPath2

        public java.lang.String[] CheckerInPath2(Checker Checker,
                                         Checker[] Checkers,
                                         java.lang.String[][] coordinates,
                                         java.lang.String prevCoord,
                                         java.lang.String com)
        This method figures out what two checkers were behind the checker when it jumped.
        Specified by:
        CheckerInPath2 in interface CheckerInterface
        Parameters:
        Checker - the current checker the user wishes to move
        Checkers - the array of all checker pieces on the board
        coordinates - a 2-dimensional array of checkers currently on the board used to compare x and y coordinates
        prevCoord - the coordinate that the checker piece that the user wants to move is currently on
        com - used to compare coordinates for selected king pieces
        Returns:
        return the array tl2

      • kingMe

        public java.lang.Boolean kingMe(Checker checker,
                                java.lang.String[][] board)
        Checks if user has made it to other side of board. Then depending on color of piece and if the piece is already a king or not, we set the piece to a king.
        Specified by:
        kingMe in interface CheckerInterface
        Parameters:
        checker - the current checker the user is attempting to move
        board - the array containing the coordinates of the board
        Returns:
        return true if the piece is on the other side of the board and is not a king, otherwise return false

        checks if the tile selected has the selected checker on it
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Checkers - the array of checkers on the board
        Returns:
